text: The International Seismological Centre (ISC) is a group that studies earthquakes around the world.; . It is not run by any government and doesn't make money. It was started in 1964 to collect and study earthquake data from many countries, especially from a new system called the World-Wide Standard Seismograph Network (WWSSN).; . The ISC's main job is to gather all the earthquake information it can, check it carefully, and make a trusted list of earthquakes.. Many experts see the ISCâ€™s earthquake list as the best and most complete.. In a 2008 document the U.S. Geological Survey said "it is because of the ISC's authoritative role that the USGS continues to refer to its final bulletin publication as 'preliminary'. == Notes == == Sources == * . *. *. *. *. *. ==External links== * Category:Earthquakes Category:Seismology
title: International Seismological Centre
